intro: Lagenocarpus bracteosus, commonly known as the bracted lagenocarpus, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa, characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
